summary: TSA is most visible at the airport, but it also has a role in protecting mass transit, rail, and other surface transportation. TSA received about $113 million a year in 2009-2018 for surface transportation activities, including training and exercises for system operators and government security partners. TSA’s Policy, Plans, and Engagement office runs the training program, but other offices contribute—e.g., the Intelligence & Analysis office...
title: Surface Transportation: TSA Should Improve Coordination Procedures for Its Security Training Program
